do-resource-elastigroup_aws.body:
resource "elastigroup_aws" "$1" {
    # perform_at - (Required) In the event of a fallback to On-Demand instances, select the time period to revert back to Spot. Supported Arguments – always (default), timeWindow, never. For timeWindow or never to be valid the group must have availabilityOriented OR persistence defined.
    perform_at = ""

    # fallback_to_ondemand - (Required) In a case of no Spot instances available, Elastigroup will launch on-demand instances instead.
    fallback_to_ondemand = ""

    # instance_type - (Required) Name of instance type (String).
    instance_type = ""

    # instance_types_ondemand - (Required) The type of instance determines your instance's CPU capacity, memory and storage (e.g., m1.small, c1.xlarge).
    instance_types_ondemand = ""

    # instance_types_ondemand - (Required) The type of instance determines your instance's CPU capacity, memory and storage (e.g., m1.small, c1.xlarge).
    instance_types_ondemand = ""

    # instance_types_spot - (Required) One or more instance types.
    instance_types_spot = ""

    # instance_types_ondemand - (Required) The type of instance determines your instance's CPU capacity, memory and storage (e.g., m1.small, c1.xlarge).
    instance_types_ondemand = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) A list of associated security group IDS.
    security_groups = ""

    # product - (Required) Operation system type. Valid values: `"Linux/UNIX"`, `"SUSE Linux"`, `"Windows"`.  For EC2 Classic instances:  `"Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC)"`, `"SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC)"`, `"Windows (Amazon VPC)"`.    
    product = ""

    # name - (Required) The group name.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The group description.
    description = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of Strings of availability zones. Note: When this parameter is set, `subnet_ids` should be left unused.
    availability_zones = ""

    # subnet_ids - (Optional) List of Strings of subnet identifiers. Note: When this parameter is set, `availability_zones` should be left unused.
    subnet_ids = ""

    # region - (Optional) The AWS region your group will be created in. Note: This parameter is required if you specify subnets (through subnet_ids). This parameter is optional if you specify Availability Zones (through availability_zones).
    region = ""

    # preferred_availability_zones - (Optional) The AZs to prioritize when launching Spot instances. If no markets are available in the Preferred AZs, Spot instances are launched in the non-preferred AZs.  Note: Must be a sublist of `availability_zones` and `orientation` value must not be `"equalAzDistribution"`.
    preferred_availability_zones = ""

    # max_size - (Optional) (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # min_size - (Optional) (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    min_size = ""

    # max_size - (Optional) (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Optional) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # max_size - (Optional) (Optional; Required if using scaling policies) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # capacity_unit - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `"instance"`) The capacity unit to launch instances by. If not specified, when choosing the weight unit, each instance will weight as the number of its vCPUs.
    capacity_unit = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) The ID of the AMI used to launch the instance.
    image_id = ""

    # iam_instance_profile - (Optional) The ARN or name of an IAM instance profile to associate with launched instances.
    iam_instance_profile = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) The key name that should be used for the instance.
    key_name = ""

    # enable_monitoring - (Optional) Indicates whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.
    enable_monitoring = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.
    user_data = ""

    # shutdown_script - (Optional) The Base64-encoded shutdown script that executes prior to instance termination, for more information please see: [Shutdown Script](https://api.spotinst.com/integration-docs/elastigroup/concepts/compute-concepts/shutdown-scripts/)
    shutdown_script = ""

    # ebs_optimized - (Optional) Enable high bandwidth connectivity between instances and AWS’s Elastic Block Store (EBS). For instance types that are EBS-optimized by default this parameter will be ignored.
    ebs_optimized = ""

    # placement_tenancy - (Optional) Enable dedicated tenancy. Note: There is a flat hourly fee for each region in which dedicated tenancy is used.
    placement_tenancy = ""

    # instance_types_preferred_spot - (Optional) Prioritize a subset of spot instance types. Must be a subset of the selected spot instance types.
    instance_types_preferred_spot = ""

    # instance_types_weights - (Optional) List of weights per instance type for weighted groups. Each object in the list should have the following attributes: `weight` - (Required) Weight per instance type (Integer).
    instance_types_weights = ""

    # instance_types_weights - (Optional) List of weights per instance type for weighted groups. Each object in the list should have the following attributes: `weight` - (Required) Weight per instance type (Integer).
    instance_types_weights = ""

    # instance_types_weights - (Optional) List of weights per instance type for weighted groups. Each object in the list should have the following attributes: `weight` - (Required) Weight per instance type (Integer).
    instance_types_weights = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # wait_for_capacity - (Optional) Minimum number of instances in a 'HEALTHY' status that is required before continuing. This is ignored when updating with blue/green deployment. Cannot exceed `desired_capacity`.
    wait_for_capacity = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # wait_for_capacity_timeout - (Optional) Time (seconds) to wait for instances to report a 'HEALTHY' status. Useful for plans with multiple dependencies that take some time to initialize. Leave undefined or set to `0` to indicate no wait. This is ignored when updating with blue/green deployment. 
    wait_for_capacity_timeout = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # orientation - (Optional) (Required, Default: `"balanced"`) Select a prediction strategy. Valid values: `"balanced"`, `"costOriented"`, `"equalAzDistribution"`, `"availabilityOriented"`.    
    orientation = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # spot_percentage - (Optional) (Optional; Required if not using `ondemand_count`) The percentage of Spot instances that would spin up from the `desired_capacity` number.
    spot_percentage = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # ondemand_count - (Optional) (Optional; Required if not using `spot_percentage`) Number of on demand instances to launch in the group. All other instances will be spot instances. When this parameter is set the `spot_percentage` parameter is being ignored.
    ondemand_count = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # draining_timeout - (Optional) The time in seconds, the instance is allowed to run while detached from the ELB. This is to allow the instance time to be drained from incoming TCP connections before terminating it, during a scale down operation.
    draining_timeout = ""

    # cpu_credits - (Optional) Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.
    cpu_credits = ""

    # utilize_reserved_instances - (Optional) In a case of any available reserved instances, Elastigroup will utilize them first before purchasing Spot instances.
    utilize_reserved_instances = ""

    # health_check_type - (Optional) The service that will perform health checks for the instance. Valid values: `"ELB"`, `"HCS"`, `"TARGET_GROUP"`, `"MLB"`, `"EC2"`, `"MULTAI_TARGET_SET"`, `"MLB_RUNTIME"`, `"K8S_NODE"`, `"NOMAD_NODE"`, `"ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE"`.
    health_check_type = ""

    # health_check_grace_period - (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to starts and check its health.
    health_check_grace_period = ""

    # health_check_type - (Optional) The service that will perform health checks for the instance. Valid values: `"ELB"`, `"HCS"`, `"TARGET_GROUP"`, `"MLB"`, `"EC2"`, `"MULTAI_TARGET_SET"`, `"MLB_RUNTIME"`, `"K8S_NODE"`, `"NOMAD_NODE"`, `"ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE"`.
    health_check_type = ""

    # health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement - (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, that we will wait before replacing an instance that is running and became unhealthy (this is only applicable for instances that were once healthy).
    health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # elastic_ips - (Optional) A list of [AWS Elastic IP](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html) allocation IDs to associate to the group instances.
    elastic_ips = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # revert_to_spot - (Optional) Hold settings for strategy correction – replacing On-Demand for Spot instances. Supported Values: `"never"`, `"always"`, `"timeWindow"`
    revert_to_spot = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # time_windows - (Optional) Specify a list of time windows for to execute revertToSpot strategy. Time window format: `ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm`. Example: `Mon:03:00-Wed:02:30`
    time_windows = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-elastigroup_aws.description: Provides a Spotinst AWS group resource.

do-resource-elastigroup_aws_beanstalk.body:
resource "elastigroup_aws_beanstalk" "$1" {
    # beanstalk_environment_name - (Required) The name of an existing Beanstalk environment.
    beanstalk_environment_name = ""

    # instance_types_spot - (Required) One or more instance types. To maximize the availability of Spot instances, select as many instance types as possible.
    instance_types_spot = ""

    # beanstalk_environment_name - (Required) The name of an existing Beanstalk environment.
    beanstalk_environment_name = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Required) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # min_size - (Required) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    min_size = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # product - (Required) Operation system type. Valid values: `"Linux/UNIX"`, `"SUSE Linux"`, `"Windows"`. For EC2 Classic instances:  `"Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC)"`, `"SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC)"`, `"Windows (Amazon VPC)"`.   
    product = ""

    # region - (Required) The AWS region your group will be created in. Cannot be changed after the group has been created.
    region = ""

    # name - (Required) The group name.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The group description.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-elastigroup_aws_beanstalk.description: Provides a Spotinst AWS group resource using Elastic Beanstalk.

do-resource-elastigroup_azure.body:
resource "elastigroup_azure" "$1" {
    # task_type - (Required) The task type to run. Valid Values: `backup_ami`, `scale`, `scaleUp`, `roll`, `statefulUpdateCapacity`, `statefulRecycle`.
    task_type = ""

    # cron_expression - (Required) A valid cron expression (`* * * * *`). The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format Cron Expression Validator Script.
    cron_expression = ""

    # login - (Required) Describes the login configuration.
    login = ""

    # login - (Required) Describes the login configuration.
    login = ""

    # user_name - (Required) Set admin access for accessing your VMs.
    user_name = ""

    # login - (Required) Describes the login configuration.
    login = ""

    # network - (Required) Defines the Virtual Network and Subnet for your Elastigroup.
    network = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) Vnet Resource Group Name.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # network - (Required) Defines the Virtual Network and Subnet for your Elastigroup.
    network = ""

    # subnet_name - (Required) ID of subnet.
    subnet_name = ""

    # network - (Required) Defines the Virtual Network and Subnet for your Elastigroup.
    network = ""

    # virtual_network_name - (Required) Name of Vnet.
    virtual_network_name = ""

    # network - (Required) Defines the Virtual Network and Subnet for your Elastigroup.
    network = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # image - (Required) Image of a VM. An image is a template for creating new VMs. Choose from Azure image catalogue (marketplace) or use a custom image.
    image = ""

    # load_balancers - (Required) Describes a set of one or more classic load balancer target groups and/or Multai load balancer target sets.
    load_balancers = ""

    # target_set_id - (Required) The scale set ID associated with the load balancer.
    target_set_id = ""

    # load_balancers - (Required) Describes a set of one or more classic load balancer target groups and/or Multai load balancer target sets.
    load_balancers = ""

    # balancer_id - (Required) The balancer ID.
    balancer_id = ""

    # load_balancers - (Required) Describes a set of one or more classic load balancer target groups and/or Multai load balancer target sets.
    load_balancers = ""

    # type - (Required) The resource type. Valid values: CLASSIC, TARGET_GROUP, MULTAI_TARGET_SET.
    type = ""

    # load_balancers - (Required) Describes a set of one or more classic load balancer target groups and/or Multai load balancer target sets.
    load_balancers = ""

    # strategy - (Required) Describes the deployment strategy.
    strategy = ""

    # strategy - (Required) Describes the deployment strategy.
    strategy = ""

    # strategy - (Required) Describes the deployment strategy.
    strategy = ""

    # low_priority_sizes - (Required) Available Low-Priority sizes.
    low_priority_sizes = ""

    # od_sizes - (Required) Available On-Demand sizes
    od_sizes = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Required) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # min_size - (Required) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    min_size = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # product - (Required) Operation system type. Valid values: `"Linux"`, `"Windows"`.
    product = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Required) Name of the Resource Group for Elastigroup.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # region - (Required) The region your Azure group will be created in.
    region = ""

    # name - (Required) The group name.
    name = ""

    # low_priority_percentage - (Optional) (Optional, Default `100`) Percentage of Low Priority instances to maintain. Required if `od_count` is not specified.
    low_priority_percentage = ""

    # od_count - (Optional) Number of On-Demand instances to maintain. Required if low_priority_percentage is not specified.
    od_count = ""

    # draining_timeout - (Optional) (Optional, Default `120`) Time (seconds) to allow the instance to be drained from incoming TCP connections and detached from MLB before terminating it during a scale-down operation.
    draining_timeout = ""

    # auto_weight - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `false`)
    auto_weight = ""

    # publisher - (Optional) Image publisher. Required if resource_group_name is not specified.
    publisher = ""

    # offer - (Optional) Name of the image to use. Required if publisher is specified.
    offer = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) Base64-encoded MIME user data to make available to the instances.
    user_data = ""

    # sku - (Optional) Image's Stock Keeping Unit, which is the specific version of the image. Required if publisher is specified.
    sku = ""

    # resource_group_name - (Optional) Name of Resource Group for custom image. Required if publisher not specified.
    resource_group_name = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) Name of the custom image. Required if resource_group_name is specified.
    image_name = ""

    # health_check - (Optional) Describes the health check configuration.
    health_check = ""

    # health_check_type - (Optional) Health check used to validate VM health. Valid values: “INSTANCE_STATE”.
    health_check_type = ""

    # health_check - (Optional) Describes the health check configuration.
    health_check = ""

    # grace_period - (Optional) Period of time (seconds) to wait for VM to reach healthiness before monitoring for unhealthiness.
    grace_period = ""

    # health_check - (Optional) Describes the health check configuration.
    health_check = ""

    # auto_healing - (Optional) Enable auto-healing of unhealthy VMs.
    auto_healing = ""

    # assign_public_up - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `false`) Assign a public IP to each VM in the Elastigroup.
    assign_public_up = ""

    # ssh_public_key - (Optional) SSH for admin access to Linux VMs. Required for Linux product types.
    ssh_public_key = ""

    # password - (Optional) Password for admin access to Windows VMs. Required for Windows product types.
    password = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # is_enabled - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `true`) Describes whether the task is enabled. When true the task should run when false it should not run.
    is_enabled = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # scale_min_capacity - (Optional) The min capacity of the group. Should be used when choosing ‘task_type' of ‘scale'.
    scale_min_capacity = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # scale_max_capacity - (Optional) The max capacity of the group. Required when ‘task_type' is ‘scale'.
    scale_max_capacity = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # scale_target_capacity - (Optional) The target capacity of the group. Should be used when choosing ‘task_type' of ‘scale'.
    scale_target_capacity = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # adjustment - (Optional) The number of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed.
    adjustment = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # adjustment_percentage - (Optional) The percent of instances to add/remove to/from the target capacity when scale is needed.
    adjustment_percentage = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # batch_size_percentage - (Optional) The percentage size of each batch in the scheduled deployment roll. Required when the 'task_type' is 'roll'.
    batch_size_percentage = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # grace_period - (Optional) The time to allow instances to become healthy. 
    grace_period = ""

    # scheduled_task - (Optional) Describes the configuration of one or more scheduled tasks.
    scheduled_task = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-elastigroup_azure.description: Provides a Spotinst elastigroup Azure resource.

do-resource-elastigroup_gcp.body:
resource "elastigroup_gcp" "$1" {
    # ports - (Required) A list of ports.
    ports = ""

    # port_name - (Required) The name of the port.
    port_name = ""

    # service_name - (Required) 
    service_name = ""

    # network - (Required) Network resource for this group.
    network = ""

    # count - (Required) The number of GPUs. Must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8.
    count = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of GPU instance. Valid values: `nvidia-tesla-v100`, `nvidia-tesla-p100`, `nvidia-tesla-k80`.
    type = ""

    # instance_types_custom - (Required) Defines a set of custom instance types. Required if instance_types_preemptible and instance_types_on_demand are not set.
    instance_types_custom = ""

    # instance_types_custom - (Required) Defines a set of custom instance types. Required if instance_types_preemptible and instance_types_on_demand are not set.
    instance_types_custom = ""

    # instance_types_on_demand - (Required) The regular VM instance type to use for mixed-type groups and when falling back to on-demand. Required if instance_types_preemptible is not set.
    instance_types_on_demand = ""

    # availability_zones - (Required) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # instance_types_preemptible - (Required) The preemptible VMs instance type. To maximize cost savings and market availability, select as many types as possible. Required if instance_types_on_demand is not set.
    instance_types_preemptible = ""

    # availability_zones - (Required) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # subnet_names - (Required) The names of the subnets in the region.
    subnet_names = ""

    # availability_zones - (Required) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # region - (Required) The region for the group of subnets.
    region = ""

    # availability_zones - (Required) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # availability_zones - (Required) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Required) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # min_size - (Required) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    min_size = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # name - (Required) The group name. 
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The region your GCP group will be created in.
    description = ""

    # startup_script - (Optional) Create and run your own startup scripts on your virtual machines to perform automated tasks every time your instance boots up.
    startup_script = ""

    # service_account - (Optional) The email of the service account in which the group instances will be launched.
    service_account = ""

    # subnets - (Optional) A list of regions and subnets.
    subnets = ""

    # memory_gib - (Optional) The memory (in GiB) in the custom instance types. GCP has a number of limitations on accepted memory values.For more information, see the GCP documentation (here.)[https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/creating-instance-with-custom-machine-type#specifications]
    memory_gib = ""

    # preemptible_percentage - (Optional) Percentage of Preemptible VMs to spin up from the "desired_capacity".
    preemptible_percentage = ""

    # on_demand_count - (Optional) Number of regular VMs to launch in the group. The rest will be Preemptible VMs. When this parameter is specified, the preemptible_percentage parameter is being ignored.
    on_demand_count = ""

    # preemptible_percentage - (Optional) Percentage of Preemptible VMs to spin up from the "desired_capacity".
    preemptible_percentage = ""

    # fallback_to_od - (Optional) Activate fallback-to-on-demand. When provisioning an instance, if no Preemptible market is available, fallback-to-on-demand will provision an On-Demand instance to maintain the group capacity.
    fallback_to_od = ""

    # preemptible_percentage - (Optional) Percentage of Preemptible VMs to spin up from the "desired_capacity".
    preemptible_percentage = ""

    # draining_timeout - (Optional) Time (seconds) the instance is allowed to run after it is detached from the group. This is to allow the instance time to drain all the current TCP connections before terminating it.
    draining_timeout = ""

    # gpu - (Optional) Defines the GPU configuration.
    gpu = ""

    # gpu - (Optional) Defines the GPU configuration.
    gpu = ""

    # health_check_grace_period - (Optional) (optional) Period of time (seconds) to wait for VM to reach healthiness before monitoring for unhealthiness.
    health_check_grace_period = ""

    # network_interface - (Optional) (Required, minimum 1) Array of objects representing the network configuration for the elastigroup.
    network_interface = ""

    # network_interface - (Optional) (Required, minimum 1) Array of objects representing the network configuration for the elastigroup.
    network_interface = ""

    # access_configs - (Optional) Array of configurations.
    access_configs = ""

    # network_interface - (Optional) (Required, minimum 1) Array of objects representing the network configuration for the elastigroup.
    network_interface = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of this access configuration.
    name = ""

    # network_interface - (Optional) (Required, minimum 1) Array of objects representing the network configuration for the elastigroup.
    network_interface = ""

    # type - (Optional) Array of configurations for this interface. Currently, only ONE_TO_ONE_NAT is supported.
    type = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Tags to mark created instances.
    tags = ""

    # backend_services - (Optional) Describes the backend service configurations.
    backend_services = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Tags to mark created instances.
    tags = ""

    tags = ""

    named_port = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Tags to mark created instances.
    tags = ""

    tags = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Array of objects with key-value pairs.
    metadata = ""

    # key - (Optional) Metadata key.
    key = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Array of objects with key-value pairs.
    metadata = ""

    # value - (Optional) Metadata value.
    value = ""

    # labels - (Optional) Array of objects with key-value pairs.
    labels = ""

    # key - (Optional) Labels key.
    key = ""

    # labels - (Optional) Array of objects with key-value pairs.
    labels = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.

    # auto_delete - (Optional) Specifies whether the disk will be auto-deleted when the instance is deleted.

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # boot - (Optional) Indicates that this is a boot disk. The virtual machine will use the first partition of the disk for its root filesystem.
    boot = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # device_name - (Optional) Specifies a unique device name of your choice.
    device_name = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # interface - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `SCSI`) Specifies the disk interface to use for attaching this disk, which is either SCSI or NVME. 
    interface = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # mode - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `READ_WRITE`) The mode in which to attach this disk, either READ_WRITE or READ_ONLY.
    mode = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # source - (Optional) Specifies a valid partial or full URL to an existing Persistent Disk resource. This field is only applicable for persistent disks.
    source = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # type - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `PERSISTENT`) Specifies the type of disk, either SCRATCH or PERSISTENT.
    type = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # initialize_params - (Optional) Specifies the parameters for a new disk that will be created alongside the new instance. Use initialization parameters to create boot disks or local SSDs attached to the new instance.
    initialize_params = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # disk_size_gb - (Optional) Specifies disk size in gigabytes. Must be in increments of 2.
    disk_size_gb = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # disk_type - (Optional) (Optional, Default" `pd-standard`) Specifies the disk type to use to create the instance. Valid values: pd-ssd, local-ssd.
    disk_type = ""

    # disks - (Optional) Array of disks associated with this instance. Persistent disks must be created before you can assign them.
    disks = ""

    # source_image - (Optional) A source image used to create the disk. You can provide a private (custom) image, and Compute Engine will use the corresponding image from your project.
    source_image = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # scaling_down_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup down.
    scaling_down_policy = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # metric_name - (Optional) Metric to monitor. Valid values: "Percentage CPU", "Network In", "Network Out", "Disk Read Bytes", "Disk Write Bytes", "Disk Write Operations/Sec", "Disk Read Operations/Sec".
    metric_name = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # statistic - (Optional) Statistic by which to evaluate the selected metric. Valid values: "AVERAGE", "SAMPLE_COUNT", "SUM", "MINIMUM", "MAXIMUM", "PERCENTILE", "COUNT".
    statistic = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    threshold = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # period - (Optional) Amount of time (seconds) for which the threshold must be met in order to trigger the scaling action.
    period = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # evaluation_periods - (Optional) Number of consecutive periods in which the threshold must be met in order to trigger a scaling action.
    evaluation_periods = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # cooldown - (Optional) Time (seconds) to wait after a scaling action before resuming monitoring.
    cooldown = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # operator - (Optional) The operator used to evaluate the threshold against the current metric value. Valid values: "gt" (greater than), "get" (greater-than or equal), "lt" (less than), "lte" (less than or equal).
    operator = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # action - (Optional) Scaling action to take when the policy is triggered.
    action = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # type - (Optional) Type of scaling action to take when the scaling policy is triggered. Valid values: "adjustment", "setMinTarget", "updateCapacity", "percentageAdjustment"
    type = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # adjustment - (Optional) Value to which the action type will be adjusted. Required if using "numeric" or "percentageAdjustment" action types.
    adjustment = ""

    # scaling_up_policy - (Optional) Contains scaling policies for scaling the Elastigroup up.
    scaling_up_policy = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-elastigroup_gcp.description: Provides a Spotinst elastigroup GCP resource.

do-resource-elastigroup_gke.body:
resource "elastigroup_gke" "$1" {
    # cluster_id - (Required) The name of the GKE cluster you wish to import.
    cluster_id = ""

    # cluster_zone_name - (Required) The zone where the cluster is hosted.
    cluster_zone_name = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Required) The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # min_size - (Required) The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    min_size = ""

    # max_size - (Required) The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.
    max_size = ""

    # name - (Optional) The group name.
    name = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # node_image - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `COS`) The image that will be used for the node VMs. Possible values: COS, UBUNTU.
    node_image = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # preemptible_percentage - (Optional) The percentage of preemptible VMs that would spin up from the desired capacity (range: 0-100).
    preemptible_percentage = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # instance_types_preemptible - (Optional) The preemptible VMs instance type. To maximize cost savings and market availability, select as many types as possible. Required if instance_types_on_demand is not set.
    instance_types_preemptible = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # instance_types_on_demand - (Optional) The regular VM instance type to use for mixed-type groups and when falling back to on-demand. Required if instance_types_preemptible is not set.
    instance_types_on_demand = ""

    # availability_zones - (Optional) List of availability zones for the group.
    availability_zones = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-elastigroup_gke.description: Provides a Spotinst elastigroup GKE resource.

do-resource-ocean_aws.body:
resource "ocean_aws" "$1" {
    # security_groups - (Required) One or more security group ids.
    security_groups = ""

    # image_id - (Required) ID of the image used to launch the instances.
    image_id = ""

    # subnet_ids - (Required) A comma-separated list of subnet identifiers for the Ocean cluster. Subnet IDs should be configured with auto assign public ip.
    subnet_ids = ""

    # region - (Required) The region the cluster will run in.
    region = ""

    # controller_id - (Required) The ocean cluster identifier. Example: `ocean.k8s`
    controller_id = ""

    # name - (Required) The cluster name.
    name = ""

    # max_size - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `1000`) The upper limit of instances the cluster can scale up to.
    max_size = ""

    # min_size - (Optional) The lower limit of instances the cluster can scale down to.
    min_size = ""

    # desired_capacity - (Optional) The number of instances to launch and maintain in the cluster.
    desired_capacity = ""

    # whitelist - (Optional) Instance types allowed in the Ocean cluster. Cannot be configured if `blacklist` is configured.
    whitelist = ""

    # blacklist - (Optional) Instance types not allowed in the Ocean cluster. Cannot be configured if `whitelist` is configured.
    blacklist = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) Base64-encoded MIME user data to make available to the instances.
    user_data = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) The key pair to attach the instances.
    key_name = ""

    # iam_instance_profile - (Optional) The instance profile iam role.
    iam_instance_profile = ""

    # fallback_to_ondemand - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `true`) If not Spot instance markets are available, enable Ocean to launch On-Demand instances instead.
    fallback_to_ondemand = ""

    # spot_percentage - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `100`) The percentage of Spot instances the cluster should maintain. Min 0, max 100.
    spot_percentage = ""

    # utilize_reserved_instances - (Optional) (Optional, Default `false`) If Reserved instances exist, OCean will utilize them before launching Spot instances.
    utilize_reserved_instances = ""

    # autoscaler - (Optional) Describes the Ocean Kubernetes autoscaler.
    autoscaler = ""

    # autoscale_is_enabled - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `true`) Enable the Ocean Kubernetes autoscaler.
    autoscale_is_enabled = ""

    # autoscale_is_auto_config - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `true`) Automatically configure and optimize headroom resources.
    autoscale_is_auto_config = ""

    # autoscale_cooldown - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `null`) Cooldown period between scaling actions.
    autoscale_cooldown = ""

    # autoscale_headroom - (Optional) Spare resource capacity management enabling fast assignment of Pods without waiting for new resources to launch.
    autoscale_headroom = ""

    # cpu_per_unit - (Optional) Optionally configure the number of CPUs to allocate the headroom. CPUs are denoted in millicores, where 1000 millicores = 1 vCPU.
    cpu_per_unit = ""

    # memory_per_unit - (Optional) Optionally configure the amount of memory (MB) to allocate the headroom.
    memory_per_unit = ""

    # num_of_units - (Optional) The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU and memory.
    num_of_units = ""

    # autoscale_down - (Optional) Auto Scaling scale down operations.
    autoscale_down = ""

    # evaluation_periods - (Optional) (Optional, Default: `null`) The number of evaluation periods that should accumulate before a scale down action takes place.
    evaluation_periods = ""

    # resource_limits - (Optional) Optionally set upper and lower bounds on the resource usage of the cluster.
    resource_limits = ""

    # max_vcpu - (Optional) The maximum cpu in vCPU units that can be allocated to the cluster.
    max_vcpu = ""

    # max_memory_gib - (Optional) The maximum memory in GiB units that can be allocated to the cluster.
    max_memory_gib = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Optionally adds tags to instances launched in an Ocean cluster.
    tags = ""

    # tag_key - (Optional) The tag key.
    tag_key = ""

    # tag_value - (Optional) The tag value.
    tag_value = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
do-resource-ocean_aws.description: Provides a Spotinst Ocean AWS resource.

do-resource-subscription.body:
resource "subscription" "$1" {
    # endpoint - (Required) The endpoint the notification will be sent to: url in case of `"http"`/`"https"`, email address in case of `"email"`/`"email-json"`, sns-topic-arn in case of `"aws-sns"`.
    endpoint = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The protocol to send the notification. Valid values: `"http"`, `"https"`, `"email"`, `"email-json"`, `"aws-sns"`, `"web"`.
    protocol = ""

    # event_type - (Required) The event to send the notification when triggered. Valid values: `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATED"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_UNHEALTHY_IN_ELB"`, `"GROUP_ROLL_FAILED"`, `"GROUP_ROLL_FINISHED"`, `"CANT_SCALE_UP_GROUP_MAX_CAPACITY"`, `"GROUP_UPDATED"`, `"AWS_EC2_CANT_SPIN_OD"`, `"AWS_EMR_PROVISION_TIMEOUT"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_READY_SIGNAL_TIMEOUT"`. 
    event_type = ""

    # resource_id - (Required) Spotinst Resource ID (Elastigroup ID).
    resource_id = ""

    # format - (Optional) The format of the notification content (JSON Format - Key+Value). Valid values: `"%instance-id%"`, `"%event%"`, `"%resource-id%"`, `"%resource-name%"`. ## Attributes Reference
    format = ""

    # id - (Optional) The subscription ID.
    id = ""

    # format - (Optional) The format of the notification content (JSON Format - Key+Value). Valid values: `"%instance-id%"`, `"%event%"`, `"%resource-id%"`, `"%resource-name%"`. ## Attributes Reference
    format = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
